sub_topic: Identifying the Lewis structure of a molecule
message_1: What is the Lewis structure of the carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule?
message_2:
The Lewis structure of carbon dioxide (CO2) consists of a carbon atom (C) double-bonded to two oxygen atoms (O). Here's a simple representation of the structure:

O=C=O

In this structure, the carbon atom shares two pairs of electrons with each oxygen atom, forming two double bonds. The carbon atom has a total of 4 valence electrons, while each oxygen atom has 6 valence electrons. By forming double bonds, all atoms achieve a full octet, satisfying the octet rule.
